full_threads.body:
Thanks Heath! I just processed it to see how it goes. Don't love that people can cancel their own subscriptions, but I guess that's PayPal for you.

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Casey, 

Ah yes ok, makes sense and definitely don't want to miss out on the EU market. 

To answer your question, yes PayPal is running, it's just missing the features below which I don't think you will really need. 

I have setup a dummy product for you to try out: https://tarabliss.com.au/?add-to-cart=15354 It's set to charge $2 every day for 3 days. 

This will give you the customer experience condensed down into days versus months.

Oh if I could choose I would go Stripe-only all the way, we've never used PayPal before, it's a new adventure. It's just that we have a growing community in the EU who don't have Visa debit and such, only regular old debit cards which don't work with Stripe. So if someone wants to just pay with their own cash or doesn't even have access to a credit card at all, there's a huge barrier to join.

Unless you have another creative solution for us on that front we aren't left with much choice but to give PP a crack.

Do I understand correctly that technically PP is working now for subscriptions, but just not with the additional capabilities?

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Thanks Casey, 

Yeah, they are very strict. Would you believe they wouldn't even email me the below. I was explaining to him that they are just instructions with zero risk of me gaining access to any sensitive material haha. 

Ok so you can reply to that email with the responses to the below, but, the PayPal account will work without it. The only features that won't work are:

  • Allowing a customer to have multiple subscriptions
  • The ability to change the recurring monthly amount once they have signed up
  • Changing of the payment due dates, e.g. changing from the 30th of every month to the 22nd of each month
  • The ability for a customer to change their method of payment once they sign up
  • The ability for an admin to change the method of payment once a customer has signed up 
These are all deemed 'advanced' features and you probably would be fine.

If your customers are not too fussed on PayPal, I would also consider just using Stripe for the convenience of having to manage only one income stream (from the website). And the fact that PayPal can be a nightmare. It will get interesting if you have to issue refunds or need help with auditing transactions etc.

Let me know how you go?

Geez, everything is like an epic quest with them. Here we go... Starting to wonder if it's really worth it: -- Dear Tara Rhianne Bliss, Thank you for contacting PayPal regarding Reference Transactions. Reference Transactions are one of our riskiest products as it allows you to change the amount and frequency of the payments being taken. As this carries such a high risk it is not something that we offer all merchants. Before we can enable this product, you will have to fill out all of the questions below for a successful application. Business information:
  1. Business name
  2. Business URL
  3. Current/anticipated total Monthly sales via all payment processors
  4. Current/anticipated monthly sales via PayPal only
Integration information:
  1. Does your business provide or support 2nd factor authentication for your customers when they are logging in?
    • If you do, please advise the type you provide
  2. Does your business use 3rd Party Fraud control outside of PayPal's own Fraud management filters?
    • If you do, please name provide the name of what is used.
  3. Please describe how you intend to use the product for or how this product would benefit your website?
  4. Do you your buyers need to initiate each subsequent payment themselves or are they processed automatically without any customer involvement?
    • If your buyers need to initiate each subsequent payment themselves on your site, you're required to have FraudNet. If you're using a mobile app and your buyers to initiate each subsequent payment themselves then Magnes is required. If you're using both a website and mobile app then both Fraudnet and Magnes are required. If you do not have FraudNet we are unable to approve your application.
  5. Will this service be enabled within your website, mobile app integration or both?
    • If your buyers need to initiate each subsequent payment themselves on your site, you're required to have FraudNet. If you're using a mobile app then Magnes is required and if you're using both a website and mobile app then both Fraudnet and Magnes are required.
  6. Please provide your website URL
    • If you do not have a website URL we are unable to approve your application.
  7. Are you integrating through another payment service provider, such as Worldpay or Ingenico?
Please make sure to fill out all questions as it is required for a successful application. Once you have completed you will send your completed answers to ICA-AU@PayPal.com and make sure to put Reference Transactions Request in the subject line and we will submit your request. Sincerely, Yago PayPal © 1999-2021 PayPal. The PayPal service is provided by PayPal Australia Pty Limited ABN 93 111 195 389 which holds Australian Financial Services Licence number 304962. Any information provided is general only and does not take into account your objectives, financial situation or needs. Please read and consider the Combined Financial Services Guide and Product Disclosure Statement before acquiring or using the service. --- Casey Rebels SUPPORT e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Casey, 

PayPal are a pain haha!! I have setup the API and IPN access. That's all good, now they need another layer of security setup. I tried to call, but they treated me like a criminal. They have sent some information over to payments@tarabliss.com.au. Can you please send that onto me?

You're making my day!

Login is payments@tarabliss.com.au

I'll text through the password now.

Hi Casey, 

Yes we can help, I would need your PayPal logins though please. 

Please let us know the login name and SMS the password to my mobile number 0415 162 271 for security reasons.

Hi team,

We've decided to enable PayPal for subscriptions and I just went to tick the box to turn it on, thinking it's already connected so it should be simple, only to find out I was wrong.

It's now saying:

PayPal is inactive for subscription transactions. Please set up the PayPal IPN and enter your API credentials to enable PayPal for Subscriptions.

Can you assist?

Many thanks!

Casey

Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Heath,

How are you this fine Monday?

We have very excitedly processed our first PayPal standard sale today.

Wondering if you had any thoughts on the subscription issue from the other week - in that there's a note next to the checkbox saying it's not recommended, and links to this article - https://docs.woocommerce.com/document/subscriptions/limitations-of-paypal-standard/

I've had a bit of a read and I can't see anything that would be a particularly big issue for our use case but I might be missing something. Mainly the reason we want to turn PayPal on is that we have a lot more EU members coming through and every year we get people saying they don't have a Visa debit card or similar (apparently it's not a thing in some EU countries, just regular debit cards) and so they can't process via Stripe, and request PayPal. It's awesome we've got it now for the standard checkout, but a huge portion of Rebels' members come through on the payment plan so it would be good to give them that option.

Is this a pain in your experience? Or would we be safe to turn PayPal on for the subscription product?

Cheers,

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Ah! One of these days I'm going to remember to check that first.

Also - PayPal is back on, and our pre-sale cart is closed so we're able to test the subscription thing.

And, sorry to be annoying but I noticed that ActiveMember360 has an update sitting there. Are we due to have our updates done before the 24th when the standard cart opens again?

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Casey, 

I think it's just cached on your machine. It's loading correctly at our end, screen shot attached.

Hello again...

I might be dreaming but on our end it looks like the company field and billing address 2 have checked back as required. Billing address 2 is at least still checked as hidden.

Maybe we just hide the company as well?

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Heath,

Just FYI... We've paused PP for a beat as they're requesting further documentation from Tara (it's a new account).

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Awesome thanks so much! I just went to have a peek and it's only turned on for the standard cart, not subscriptions, is that right? There's a note about not using PayPal for subscriptions - any way around that?

As for the required custom field thing, we have no idea what's triggering it either. It just seemed to reset over night again, and again, and again. Fingers crossed it sticks this time!

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Casey, 

We have configured PayPal for you. Looks like you were really close! 

We have also:

  • Removed the address 2 field as it's kind of overkill, people can enter everything they need to in the Address field 1. 
  • Made the Company field unrequired (both in the plugin) and hard coded as it seemed to be randomly changing back to un-required. Let's see how it goes?

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

Hope you had an excellent weekend :)

We would love to integrate PayPal with the WooCommerce set up and I went in to try and get it set up myself, thinking it would be a couple clicks and we're done kind of thing, only to find it is far more involved that I anticipated.

Are you able to assist with linking this up for us?

Also, we're still waiting to hear back from Joel about the custom fields turning themselves back on to a required status after we've clicked the check box to turn them off. He said he'd sorted it out but we still have people having to enter data into fields that they don't have responses to (company and billing address 2, specifically). Do you know much about what's happening here? We can't figure it out at all.

Our main concern here is that it's a nice easy 'out' for someone who might be at the cart but still umming and ahhing and looking for a reason to not go through with the investment to say 'oh too hard, checkout didn't work... it's not the right time'. After all, we are tending to a crowd here who will often be looking for a 'sign' - we don't want to give them any "bad" ones.

Thank you!

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light
